intro: Dimorphotheca calendulacea, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flower heads with white ray florets, resembling a dandelion. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Dimorphotheca calendulacea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
